overview_of_class: An analysis of the ethical issues that arise as a result of developments in medicine and biotechnology. Topics considered will include cloning and stem cell transplantation, human and animal research, new reproductive technologies, the definition of death, abortion, euthanasia, and the allocation of resources.
name: Bioethics
title: WCAS PHIL 269-0-20 Bioethics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: An analysis of the ethical issues that arise as a result of developments in medicine and biotechnology. Topics considered will include cloning and stem cell transplantation, human and animal research, new reproductive technologies, the definition of death, abortion, euthanasia, and the allocation of resources.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: To develop insight into and appreciation for the way philosophical analysis and argument can contribute to clarifying the ethical issues in complex and controversial topics in biotechnology and medicine.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: The student will be evaluated in relation to four things: a case analysis ((25%), an essay on an assigned topic (30%), a final take home essay exam (30%), and participation in discussion (15%).

subject: PHIL
